WorkItem.Description: Nevermind...   I should read more before I ask silly questions...sorry

Comments.Message:
A) We've made it as easy as possible to build an upgrade list, and save that upgrade list, so that you can *very* quickly open it again in the future, and/or just leave it open to check when something drops. At the cost of just a little alt-tabbing, you get fully accurate upgrade valuation.

B) If you *really* can't be bothered to alt-tab, and *really* don't care about accuracy (no, really, I'm serious. Stat weights are downright wrong, very frequently. Don't underestimate how wrong they are. If you even remotely care about your performance (and I assume you do, since you're using Rawr), you *really* shouldn't use stat weights), Rawr already does support exporting to Pawn. Just goto the Relative Stat Values chart, *THOROUGHLY READ THE BIG RED WARNING*, then read it again, make sure you understand it, read it again one more time for good measure, then click Export in the top right.
(In case it wasn't clear, Relative Stat Values, aka Stat Weights, are wrong, and you shouldn't use them.)

(And also, if you just brush these warnings off, and think "Yeah, they're off, but they're close enough", think again. They're really wrong, quite often, completely misleading you. You might as well just be choosing gear by gearscore.)
